attributes.action: CHANGE THE EUROCENTRIC CURRICULUM - TEACH BLACK HISTORY
attributes.additional_details: It is incredibly damaging for black youth to grow up thinking they are the underclass, which is reinforced when the most black history they are taught is politicianry & MLK, which hardly scrapes the surface of all the positive influences/events in black history. Furthermore, it reinforces the institutional racism throughout society if white students are brought up in an environment which devalues black people, & ignores their existence. Black students need to feel liberated & this is the way forward.
attributes.background: Change the curriculum to include prominent black figures in history, praise all races from an early age, teach literature from written by black authors, educate on black led movements & successes, teach black students where they came from, & show white students what they’ve gained from BAME efforts.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Add education on diversity and racism to all school curriculums: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323808

Making the UK education curriculum more inclusive of BAME history: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323961

Teach Britain's colonial past as part of the UK's compulsory curriculum: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324092

We have also published several petitions about race and equality more widely, which you can view here: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions?state=open&topic=race-and-equality
